title: What is the best type of clarinet reed? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve tried Legere, Daddario, and Vandoren and keep coming back to Vandoren, so that’s my personal favorite. I play on 4 1/2 strength Rue Lepic (black box) reeds, but that depends on a lot of things- how big you are (physically), the mouthpiece you play on, so the strength is really something a player needs to figure out for themselves. However, each reed brand has its strengths and some Daddarios might go better with certain mouthpieces. It matters only if you find the best reed for your mouthpiece, and there is a whole lot of variance there. It takes a lot of experimenting and will continue that way until you find the mouthpiece of your dreams. If you are looking to start, then a 2 1/2–3 strength blue box Vandoren or Daddario reserve is the choice for you. That is pretty standard.

I used to play clarinet in middle school but had to quit in order to keep playing football, so my memory is rough. My teacher would recommend Vandoren reeds, but the last time I played on one was about 5 years ago so I do not remember my own experience on them.
